column4: can anyone help me find why i get a freeze at the login screen?
can someone tell me how to set ubuntu so that it doesn't start x on boot
system > administration > services, disable the graphical login
thatks
damn, that would be great except i am running as root in single user mode right now
and it won't let me open the program
well you can use sysv-rc-conf (you probably need to install it)
ok
what am i looking for in sysv-rc-conf? i'm quite new to linux and i don't know what much of this means
are you sure you don't want X if you are new?
you want to stop gdm from starting
it's crashing at the login screen so i want to login on the console before starting x
you can't just press ctrl-alt-f1?
or possibly gdm, yes
no, it totally freezes and that doesn't work
I see
so in sysv-rc-conf, what do the columns mean? in which one should I turn off gdm?
all of them, but you normalling boot into 2 so that's the only one you /really/ need to turn off
each column is a runlevel
okay
thanks for the help, i'm going to reboot and see
that didn't really help, now i just get the dump from the kernel panic instead of a boring freeze
